ticket.title: to_xml doesn't work in such case: Event.select('title as t').to_xml
ticket.original-body:
I use ruby 1.9.2 preview3 and rails 3b4
The simple select works well
@@@ ruby irb(main):042:0> Event.select('title').limit(3).to_xml => "<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<events type="array">
 <event>
 <title>★粤血PARTY★第一击！</title>
 </event>
 <event>
 <title> 荷兰爵士八人组合Electric Barbarian</title>
 </event>
 <event>
 <title>法国乐队1984中国巡演@深圳一渡堂</title>
 </event>
</events>
" @@@
but when I try this @@@ ruby irb(main):043:0> Event.select('title as t').limit(3).to_xml NoMethodError: undefined method `type' for nil:NilClass from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activesupport-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_support/whiny_nil.rb:48:in `method_missing' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activerecord-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_record/serializers/xml_serializer.rb:230:in `compute_type' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:20:in `initialize' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:73:in `new' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:73:in `block in serializable_attributes' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:72:in `each' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:72:in `map' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:72:in `serializable_attributes' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:114:in `add_attributes_and_methods' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:101:in `block in serialize' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/builder-2.1.2/lib/builder/xmlbase.rb:134:in `call' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/builder-2.1.2/lib/builder/xmlbase.rb:134:in `_nested_structures' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/builder-2.1.2/lib/builder/xmlbase.rb:58:in `method_missing' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/builder-2.1.2/lib/builder/xmlbase.rb:31:in `tag!' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:100:in `serialize' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activerecord-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_record/serializers/xml_serializer.rb:175:in `to_xml' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activesupport-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_support/xml_mini.rb:107:in `to_tag' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activesupport-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_support/core_ext/array/conversions.rb:159:in `block (2 levels) in to_xml' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activesupport-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_support/core_ext/array/conversions.rb:159:in `each' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/builder-2.1.2/lib/builder/xmlbase.rb:134:in `call' from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/builder-2.1.2/lib/builder/xmlbase.rb:134:in `_nested_structures' ticket.original-body-html:
I use ruby 1.9.2 preview3 and rails 3b4

The simple select works well

irb(main):042:0> Event.select('title').limit(3).to_xml
=> "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n<events type=\"array\">\n  <event>\n    <title>★粤血PARTY★第一击！</title>\n  </event>\n  <event>\n    <title> 荷兰爵士八人组合Electric Barbarian</title>\n  </event>\n  <event>\n    <title>法国乐队1984中国巡演@深圳一渡堂</title>\n  </event>\n</events>\n"

but when I try this

irb(main):043:0> Event.select('title as t').limit(3).to_xml
NoMethodError: undefined method type' for nil:NilClass


from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activesupport-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_support/whiny_nil.rb:48:in `method_missing'

from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activemodel-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_model/serializers/xml.rb:100:in `serialize'

from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activesupport-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_support/xml_mini.rb:107:in `to_tag'
from /opt/ruby192/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/activesupport-3.0.0.beta4/lib/active_support/core_ext/array/conversions.rb:159:in `block (2 levels) in to_xml'

from script/rails:9:in `<main>'irb(main):044:0> </code>

version.title: to_xml doesn't work in such case: Event.select('title as t').to_xml

version.body:
Just to add to the ticket it is working fine with ruby 1.8.7. I am getting following output
@@@ ruby <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <events type="array"> <event> <t type="NilClass">railsconf</t> </event> </events> @@@
version.body-html:
Just to add to the ticket it is working fine with ruby 1.8.7. I am getting following output

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<events type="array">
  <event>
    <t type="NilClass">railsconf</t>
  </event>
</events>

version.title: to_xml doesn't work in such case: Event.select('title as t').to_xml

version.body:
It's obvious that the problem is caused by this line:
type = @serializable.class.serialized_attributes.has_key?(name) ? super : @serializable.class.columns_hash[name].type
If somehow, the resulting SQL is using a dynamic column, `@serializable.class.columns_hash[name].type` will fail. In my case I'm getting the exception when evaling `@serializable.class.columns_hash["the_parent_id"].type` which is not present in the schema due it's a dynamic column.
This exception is thrown even if `:skip_types` is set to true.
version.body-html:
It's obvious that the problem is caused by this line:

    type = @serializable.class.serialized_attributes.has_key?(name) ?
      super : @serializable.class.columns_hash[name].type

If somehow, the resulting SQL is using a dynamic column, @serializable.class.columns_hash[name].type will fail.
In my case I'm getting the exception when evaling @serializable.class.columns_hash["the_parent_id"].type which is not present in the schema due it's a dynamic column.

This exception is thrown even if :skip_types is set to true.
version.title: to_xml doesn't work in such case: Event.select('title as t').to_xml

version.body: If it works on 1.8 and not in 1.9 it may be due is inheriting attributes that should not be inherited.
version.body-html: If it works on 1.8 and not in 1.9 it may be due is inheriting attributes that should not be inherited.
version.title: to_xml doesn't work in such case: Event.select('title as t').to_xml

version.body:
(from [fe0db2b80588446b34f5f89bbe73f04b88fb06c9]) to_xml doesn't work in such case: Event.select('title as t').to_xml [#4840 state:resolved]
NilClass.type is no longer defined in Ruby 1.9 and causes ActiveRecord::Base.to_xml to fail with message: undefined method `type' for nil:NilClass https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/fe0db2b80588446b34f5f89bbe73f04b88fb06c9
version.body-html:
